patterns.name: smart_tick
patterns.description: 3-layer gate before costly operations: (1) tasks exist? (2) already active? (3) cheap AI approves?

patterns.name: memory_commands
patterns.description: STORE[tags]: and SCAN[query]: parsed from AI responses for self-directed memory operations

patterns.name: subconscious_prefilter
patterns.description: Cheap local AI call to pre-analyze query before expensive main AI - determines memory needs, categorizes intent

patterns.name: udp_peer_discovery
patterns.description: UDP broadcast on fixed port for automatic peer discovery in multi-agent systems

patterns.name: health_metrics
patterns.description: Track success/failure rates, uptime, operation counts - enables learning what works over time

patterns.name: file_based_hub
patterns.description: JSON files in shared folder for cross-instance communication - simple, persistent, debuggable

patterns.name: per_agent_cooldown
patterns.description: Per-agent cooldown with last_processed_index tracking - prevents AI spam in multi-agent conversations

patterns.name: stateless_memory_query
patterns.description: Query relevant knowledge on-demand rather than carrying full conversation history

patterns.name: per_user_persona
patterns.description: Per-user persona switching with file-based user memory - personalization without global state

patterns.name: retry_cooldown
patterns.description: Failed tasks tracked with retry_after cooldown - graceful degradation, prevents hammering

patterns.name: on_ready_resume
patterns.description: DB state checked on startup, background tasks automatically resumed

patterns.name: rolling_script_context
patterns.description: Append AI responses to script list passed to next call - session memory without DB

patterns.name: input_validation_first
patterns.description: Validate before AI: flood detection, attack patterns, content safety - all before expensive calls

patterns.name: autonomous_goal_system
patterns.description: Prioritized goals in DB, decision cycle on timer thread, decisions logged for learning

patterns.name: sliding_window_rate_limit
patterns.description: Track timestamps per operation, clean old entries, calculate wait time and auto-sleep

patterns.name: multi_backend_fallback
patterns.description: Try multiple AI backends, warn on failures, only exit if ALL fail

patterns.name: hash_deduplication
patterns.description: Hash-based deduplication with snooze timers - skip unchanged files, auto-expire exclusions

patterns.name: dictionary_config
patterns.description: Dictionary-based game/mode configs - switch behavior without code changes, just swap config dicts

patterns.name: scheduled_cleanup
patterns.description: Periodic cleanup of stale data using last_seen timestamps - prevents zombie entries

patterns.name: admin_cooldown_bypass
patterns.description: reset_cooldown(ctx) for admins - regular users rate-limited, admins can spam commands

patterns.name: vault_integration
patterns.description: Topic-to-file mapping with automatic backlinks, recall via glob search across .md files

patterns.name: smart_text_chunking
patterns.description: Sentences > clauses > words hierarchy for TTS with short chunk merging to avoid choppy output

patterns.name: bot_to_bot_cooldown
patterns.description: Cooldown + probability gate for bot-to-bot chat - prevents infinite loops while allowing organic conversation

patterns.name: a_star_pathfinding
patterns.description: A* with heapq for agent pathfinding + task-based behavior system with handler registration

patterns.name: optional_asset_loading
patterns.description: Check file_exists() before loading assets (audio, images) so program runs even without optional files

patterns.name: p2p_bootstrap_discovery
patterns.description: Bootstrap nodes + last_seen tracking + dual IP handling for P2P systems with NAT traversal

patterns.name: multi_level_memory
patterns.description: Per-channel, per-user, AND per-model histories - granular context separation with independent caps

patterns.name: two_store_architecture
patterns.description: Local hub (no git, instant) + distributed repo (GitHub sync) - keep separate to avoid merge conflicts
